definition: to throw/to toss/to fling/to cast/to abandon
"hand" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 64), occurring in 提, 把, 打 etc
to abandon/to discard/to renounce/to dump (sb)
to dump (selling abroad more cheaply than cost price at home)
to throw out/to get rid of
to polish/to burnish
to drop anchor/to break down (of a car etc)
to throw down/to dump/to abandon/thrown down
to show your face in public (derog.)
lit. throw out a brick and get jade thrown back (idiom)/fig. to attract others' interest or suggestions by putting forward one's own modest ideas to get the ball rolling
parabola

to discard

to throw/to shoot

sentences.english: After leaving the smell of land behind him, he set his lines.
sentences.chinese: 在把陆地的气息抛在身后之后，他放下了钓丝。

sentences.english: She has made so many passes at me recently that I think it necessary to freeze her off.
sentences.chinese: 最近她多次向我抛送秋波，我觉得有必要疏远她。

sentences.english: Let's flip a coin to decide who should go first - do you want heads or tails?
sentences.chinese: 我们来抛硬币决定谁先走吧，你是要正面还是要反面？

sentences.english: The ball will bound back when it is thrown on the pole.
sentences.chinese: 球抛在柱上会弹回来的。

sentences.english: We left the hustle and bustle of the city behind us and departed for the beach.
sentences.chinese: 我们将都市的熙攘抛在脑后，出发前往海边。

sentences.english: The effects of four factors on techniques for seedling establishment of No-tillage seedling broadcasting cultivation of early hybrid rice were studied.
sentences.chinese: 研究了四个不同因素对杂交早稻免耕抛栽立苗的影响。

sentences.english: He threw his homework aside and watched TV.
sentences.chinese: 他把家庭作业抛到一边去看电视了。

sentences.english: Joking aside I want to reassure you that I am invited here tonight.
sentences.chinese: 抛开玩笑，我襄蜇申今晚我的确是受邀而来的。

sentences.english: Operational recommendations, the space continues to hold, near MA5 short throw.
sentences.chinese: 操作建议，空单继续持有，MA5附近短抛。

sentences.english: That year, the easy man thrown, red cherry, green banana.
sentences.chinese: 那一年，流光容易把人抛，红了樱桃，绿了芭蕉。

sentences.english: Another landed on the church steeple.
sentences.chinese: 另一颗炸弹抛在教堂的塔尖上。

sentences.english: Once you achieve the necessary change, you will be able to leave the discontented feelings behind you.
sentences.chinese: 一旦你获得必要改变，你将能够把不满感觉抛在身后。

sentences.english: You don't want to bet the farm on a coin-toss.
sentences.chinese: 你不会希望通过抛硬币来赌上农场。

sentences.english: Dozens of ships were washed ashore and more dozens were buried at the bottom of the sea.
sentences.chinese: 几十艘船被抛上海滩，更多的船只则葬身海底。

sentences.english: At our convocation ceremony we all threw our caps in the air.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的毕业典礼上，我们都把学士帽抛到空中。

sentences.english: In absconding more by accident Japanese girl Beijing child cast fall the sea, beijing child oath signs up for this enemy.
sentences.chinese: 逃亡中更误将日本少女京子抛落海，京子誓报此仇。

definition: the back of the head/(fig.) the back of one's mind

to throw/to throw away
to toss/to throw dice/Taiwan pr. [zhi2]
to cast or put aside/to forget for a while
to catch (sth thrown etc)/to receive (sth given)/to accept
to throw out/to get rid of
to swing one's arms/to wash one's hands of sth
to throw off/to abandon/to cast off/to get rid of/to dump
to lose/to put aside/to throw
to throw down/to dump/to abandon/thrown down
to turn a hand over/to put one's hand behind one's back/fig. easily done
to smash/to pound/to fail/to muck up/to bungle
to throw down/to drop (bomb)
(physics) inertia/(fig.) force of habit/tendency to do things in the accustomed way/habitual
